author: Virginia Van Zanten
title: Karlie Kloss's Favorite Vegan, Gluten-Free, Blueberry Granola Crisp
text:
“Some of my fondest memories of summer include my mom’s freshly baked fruit crisps,” writes Elizabeth Stein, founder of natural food company Purely Elizabeth . “If there were one type of dessert that I could eat for the rest of my life, this would be it.” So when it came time to create her new cookbook Eating Purely , a fruit crisp had to make the cut. “This is an updated, hassle-free version of my mom’s recipe, where fruits can easily be swapped for whatever is in season,” she writes in the book, which offers more than 100 all-natural, organic, and gluten-free recipes. And Stein isn’t the only fruit crisp fan; Karlie Kloss , a Purely Elizabeth Ancient Grain Granola devotee, also counts this tasty dessert among her favorite recipes.
Blueberry Granola Crisp vegan, gluten-free
3 cups blueberries, fresh or frozen
½ cup coconut sugar
½ lemon, juiced
3 tsp. cinnamon
2 T arrowroot powder
Topping:
2 cups Purely Elizabeth Ancient Grain Granola
2 T coconut oil or vegan butter
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, toss blueberries with the sugar, lemon juice, cinnamon, and arrowroot then spread in a baking dish. In a small bowl, combine the granola with the coconut oil or vegan butter. Sprinkle on the topping and bake for 20 minutes, or until the topping is golden and the filling is bubbling. Serve with coconut-based ice cream. “Some of my favorite brands include So Delicious, Steve’s, and Luna and Larry’s Coconut Bliss,” she writes.
